review_text: This was an extraordinary bucket list stay that will not be our last in this cozy, fully stocked, comfy, and peaceful, tiny home. What an amazing experience for my hubby and I, along with our son who recently turned 18, and his pal. The four of us had an absolute blast! We spent the evening at a Charlotte Hornets basketball game and settled into our tiny home nooks after we returned. We opened the windows to fall asleep to the soothing sounds of nature. At sunrise, the light danced across our tiny home space creating an unbelievably spacious feel. The owners were so kind and we enjoyed sharing a little bit about each other and our passion for tiny homes. Do yourself a favor and enjoy a stay in this tiny home. There are multiple venues for breakfast, lunch, and dinner within minutes but this tiny home location is peaceful and off the beaten path if calm and mindfulness is a must.

Rating, 3 stars

Â·

,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: Iâ€™ve been wanting to stay in a tiny house for some time now. Brettâ€™s place was indeed tiny but super cute. Upon arrival we had an unexpected welcome party of about 15-20 ladybugs inside, no fault of Brett. He offered to come right over & take care of them but we were able to use the vacuum provided to do a catch & release ourselves! We were not quite prepared for the paintball complex at the end of the gravel path near the home. So there was some noise from that & quite a bit of dust kicked up from the cars. But after closing time all was quiet. The shower was very small (think tiny house!) & the water pressure was really low. There was only one bath towel provided but we did have two wash cloths & a hand towel. There was coffee & essentials provided plus bottled water & some apples in the fridge. I canâ€™t say a whole lot about the bed, just a mattress on the floor of the loft. Overall it was a neat overnight experience.

name: Lauren
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
June 2023
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
If if I could give 10 stars and 2 thumbs up, I would!
We had the absolute BEST time! Off the beaten path feel, with the convenience of being real close to town.
We always try to get out and explore while we stay away from home, and this was a great location for that! We are nature lovers, and boy did we get our fill! Deer, lizards, turtles, toads, frogs, a vast variety of birds, and the friendliest host chickens!!
If nature isnâ€™t for you, Iâ€™d still highly recommend! Inside Tiny Blue is comfy and cute! Hop in your car and youâ€™re 3 minutes from a gas station and 5 minutes from the bigger stores and restaurants.
We got the pleasure of touring the Tiny Homes that Brett is currently building, as well as the neighboring paint ball field (of which we never heard a noise from, which wouldnâ€™t have bothered us a bit, but was still very nice!)
I could go on and on about the absolute pleasure we had staying here, and will definitely be back to stay again! Brett and Heather, thank you so much!

name: Mandy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
May 2022
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: Tiny Blue was just as described! The tiny house experience was fun for our family of 3. My 14 year old son loved having his own loft and ladder. Tiny living is surprisingly very functional and we enjoyed all the little nooks and crannies and storage. The front porch is wonderful and my son enjoyed sitting outside playing his guitar and singing. We were out and about most of our stay but Tiny Blue is conveniently located near Locust and the wedding venue we were at for our friends. We wish we would have had more down time to enjoy the hammock and other games in the deck box (definitely check those out). My son and fiancÃ© did get to play horseshoes and feed the chickens which was great! Just some notes and not at all a negative reflection on this place because we would absolutely stay here again. There is a paintball place past Tiny Blue and traffic can get heavy at times early on Friday morning (my early is 9am) but there is no sound from the paintball place from inside the house. Be prepared to climb stairs and hunch over to get in the bigger loft area. This was not a problem for us as we are 5â€™3 and 5â€™6 but taller people should take note. If you sit up in the middle of the night you might hit your head on the ceiling. The only other thing is if you want to sleep late be aware the sun comes through the windows and there is really no way to block this out. For us, we had to be up early anyway. Brett was very kind and very quick to offer his assistance with anything we needed. He was very friendly during our communication and I wish we could have met in person! We will definitely be staying again when we come to visit our friends!

If you read one review, read this one. The host isn't going to like this review I'm sure, but I would not stay here again. Yes, the host describes the A/C unit noise and does provide earplugs, but I went 2 nights with very little sleep due to the loud slamming bang of the AC unit (when it kicks on) and noise of it running that follows. It's unlike anything I have ever experienced at a rental before.
The space was clean and had super quirky dÃ©cor. The bed was massive and the mattress was comfortable.
I think the host is in between a rock and hard place. The AC unit is for the whole building (multiple restaurants and flats) and it just happens to be directly above the bedroom in this unit.
Overall it's not the hosts fault, but potential renters should be aware of the issue at hand.

review_text: I will say that the place was clean, bed and pillows were comfortable and it was right on the main drag. The issue we had was the noise level was HEAVILY downplayed. We stay in cities a lot and understand thereâ€™s bar patron noise and sirens/horns, etc but the listing failed to mention that there is a live music venue literally sharing the parking lot outside the apartment. It was as if we were at the bar and it played both Friday and Saturday nights until after midnight. Thereâ€™s no tv or sleeping with this level of noise, even with the provided earplugs and a white noise machine that we brought. Additionally, the noise from the AC unit was also downplayed. It is directly above the bathroom connected to the bedroom and kicks on about every 20 minutes with a startling loud bang and sounds like thereâ€™s an electric sander grinding on top of you. We were thankful Sunday night when there was no band, but we still needed the earplugs for the loud AC unit, and we are not â€œlight sleepersâ€.

When we walked in, everything was as it looked online. Everything was in pristine condition, clean sheets, bathroom was spotless, a good number of hangers in the beautiful walk in closet, shoe hanger, and Marc even had a little care package on the bed!
I prefer places like this over a hotel ANYDAY! I made coffee the next morning and to my surprise, even the coffee pot was spotless! This spot is like a home away from home. Everything you need to get to in the NODA area for us was within walking distance as we were just getting away to take a little break.
I am super impressed with the cleanliness of this place; talk about no stones unturned.. lol.. What a beautiful place and I would most definitely book again

The place was spotless and as described and Marc was very responsive to our questions. The location could not be better if you're looking to immerse yourself in the local scene -- so many resaturants, bars, cafes, and interesting things to see right on the same block. We could not believe how much activity there was on Friday night with street vendors and live music! The train that goes to downtown and UNC is 2 blocks away. The bed was very soft -- could be a plus or a minus, depending on your preferences. If you're not sensitive to noise, this is a great place to check out!

As noted in other reviews, this is not a place to go if you want â€œpeace & quietâ€. The nights are lively, the days are bustling. My favorite part was sitting in the yellow chair with the balcony doors open while I sipped my morning coffee from the Smelly Cat Cafe. At night thereâ€™s so much to do; and I enjoyed a show at the Evening Muse just down the street. Then I went home and listened to the cover band playing at Jack Beagles from my balcony. The music usually ended by midnight, but itâ€™s February soâ€¦
Marc made everything so easy for check in with very detailed instructions, and check out was a breeze. The loft is very clean. And the neighborhood, as well as the building feels very safe.

review_text: This place is amazing! It's a beautiful log cabin home on a working farm. My family and I love animals, and outdoors. Zachary was a great host and extremely accommodating. He gave us a tour of the grounds, answered all of our questions about his place and the animals, as well as giving us recommendations about hiking in the area. This place feels secluded and so peaceful, yet you are a stones through from viewing the Charlotte skyline. We attended a wedding and dinners in Charlotte and both were like 20-25 minutes from this home. HIGHLY RECOMMEND staying here. If you love nature and/or animals look no further. ;-) We have 3 boys and as soon as I saw this booking I knew this was the right place. My kids takeaway so far has only been Zachary, the log home, and all of the plants and animals. Wedding and dinner were dismal compared!

review_text:
My husband and I had a wonderful stay at Zachary's homestead.
We arrived from CT to NC early and I contacted Zachary asking if there was a way to check in early.
He had guests from the previous reservation, but said if they leave earlier and he had plenty of time to clean, we could check in.
We visited with our daughter and he gave us an early check in at 1:30, which we appreciated.
When we arrived, my husband was so excited to see the homestead.
Zachary meet us as we drove in.
He was very friendly and gave us his story of the homestead.
He introduced us to his animals as well as PUPPIES!
The home was very clean. Had everything that was noted in the ad for the AirBNB.
The plants in his home were beautiful! I was a little jealous :)
It was very relaxing watching the chickens!
You must like animals, nature and understand this is homestead life to truely appreciate his place
We both wish we had more time to spend there.
If he will have us, we will definitely use his place again.

The animals make exactly the amount of noise you'd expect from a place listed as a homestead--quiet at night but reasonably chicken-y in the mornings. It was only about a 20-30min drive to all the fun places in inner city Charlotte. The host was extremely responsive and friendly, and really looked out for our general safety and wellbeing. I couldn't recommend this place enough, we hope to go back!

If you are looking for a get-away that is full of peace and connected to the serenity of nature, his farm-cabin would be the perfect place and space for you. Iâ€™m a early riser, so I went out to see where the roosters were that were setting the atmosphere for what was going to be one of the most amazing (AirBnB) stays I have ever had. review_text: Unfortunately, we had to cut our trip short for reasons completely unrelated to the quality of the AirBnB, so take my experience with a grain of salt. The check-in process was clear. The BnB was clean and orderly. Ross was responsive and friendly. That said, the little things may make or break this place for you. The BnB is effectively a MIL suite in the backyard of the hostâ€™s houseâ€”which in and of itself is fineâ€”but you will hear kids running around. Youâ€™ll need to do a three-point turn to get out the parking spot allocated to you as a guest. The windows in the living room and bathroom do not have blinds or privacy filters. This may not concern you, as the suite is on the second story, but for my wife, she felt exposed when using the facilities, with a full view of the neighborâ€™s backyard. If you can live with these compromises, then hey, itâ€™s a great deal located in the heart of Noda, restaurants and entertainment all around, with a well-organized host with plenty of recommendations.

What a delightful spot to stay! Though the description set high expectations, they were exceeded upon arrival and during the stay.
This place offers wonderful privacy, a modern and super clean interior, comfort, quiet, easy access to various activities and easy entry/exit. Though my stay was just one night, it is the kind of place that makes you want to stay several nights. It is apparent that a lot of thought and care went into creating this home away from home.
I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others. It is a superb value for the money. Don't hesitate to book this place!

review_text: This was a perfect stay. We will definitely return to this Airbnb. It was the perfect stay for a couple. Area is spacious. Everything was extremely clean. Host responds quickly. I failed to let them know I was much earlier than expected and had to wait to be let in the gate. As long as you let them know your arrival time everything else will be seamless. This space was homey, spotless and relaxing. Itâ€™s also in a great location- close to everything. We stayed for a concert and weâ€™re only 10 minutes away. Thanks for having us! 10/10

Booked a room at LoSo last minute when needing to stay an extra night in Charlotte. The upside were: friendly helpful staff, clean room, comfy bed.
We felt that the room was a little pricey for what it was. The hotel seemed pretty dated with what felt like cheap and sloppy finishes slapped over a facility that still feels outdated.
It was not a bad stay by any means, just not what we expected based on photos, description and price. "Relax in a luxurious and convenient hotel in trendy neighborhood". Adjacent to but not exactly IN the up and coming neighborhood and questioning the luxurious part of description.
Very comfy bed and everything felt clean!

We really enjoyed our stay. Excellent location, an easy walk to many places in town, but when we got back to the condo it was very quiet and we felt a sense of privacy that we wouldn't have in a hotel in town. Also, the security was great and we always felt safe.
The space was perfect for our four night stay. Everything we could have needed was there, and the condo was very nicely appointed. It was spacious and modern, and even had an umbrella, which came in very handy during a heavy rain one night.
We didn't need the garage, but had we been driving it would be a major plus. Easily accessible and clean.
Tamara communicated easily and often, and we never felt as if we would be on our own if anything came up.
We would absolutely stay here again, and would highly recommend it.

review_text: Our stay was great. The owner was very helpful and willing to assist. I would like to note that the only tvs that worked was the one in the living room and the one outside. The one in the master bedroom would turn on but we couldn't get it to pull up any channels. We changed all inputs but still nothing. The other tv in the bedroom with multiple beds and cots would come on also but no service was connected so we couldn't watch either. The other two bedrooms have no tv at all. If you plan on swimming at night there isn't much light. I'm not sure if that is to discourage noise and swimming at night or maybe I overlooked a plug but that was unfortunate. Other than that the home was clean and the owner was great !!!
